title: Can't import a .pst from Outlook 2021 (64-bit) to Thunderbird (64-bit).
content:
I can't import a PST file from Outlook 2021 (64-bit) to Thunderbird (64-bit).

When I reach the import screen, it starts at 33% and then doesn't move at all.

Several people have asked the same question, but is there a solution?


Also, if the import is successful, will the entire folder structure be carried over?

インポートの画面に到達すると、最初から33%の状態で始まり、その後全く動きません。 いくつか同じことについて質問している人がいますが、解決策はないのでしょうか。

title: Message selection changed.
content: Recently my message selection shortcuts changed. What changed, and how do I change back to using only the shift key?

title: If one never put in a password in the first place but left it blank in my original Pop3 acount, and the same gfor my Imap acount. How can I now provide Thunderbird today with a user name and a Password that does not exist?
content: I think that I have been using Thunderbird as an email client for many many years from the early 2000's. And due to my ignorance I never provided a password for the servers in my Pop 3 I left the box blank , and the same on my Imap account. I note that it always said that the password was insecure,which is not surprising as there was no password. Now this year I updated my Ubuntu LTS to the latest LTS 2404. And something went wrong as I lost the Dual Boot facility and Windows 10. Which I had had for many years. And as of about March this year I no longer have thunderbird send to my computer any copy of emails that I send and that are sent to me. I have no doubt that it is my fault. . I have purchased a Laptop from Holland with only Ubuntu on it and that as of July this year also does not send to it this new Laptop any copies of emails that I send or that are sent to me. I was with NTLworld from the early 2000's and am now with Virginmedia.com. And they have recently merged with O2, and I have a new sign in Password and Identity . And I am unable to find the old password that I used to sign in to Virginmedia. I understand that due to cost cutting they might in future do away with providing emails for their clients in the first instance. I would really like to be able to restore Thunderbird if possible.But at 81 yrs old my comprehension is no longer what it was Regards Cliff Edwards. my Ntlworld.com email is cm.edwards1@ntlwold.com.
creator: cm.edwards1

title: How do I reduce font size for mail headers?
content:
Thunderbird 128.14.0esr on Debian 13 KDE. Email is in Classic View.

The mail headers take up far too much space.

Here's an example of the problem: http://map.atownsend.org.uk/tmp/Screenshot_20250829_150825_2.png . As you can see, about 50% of the UI is taken up by headers. I like the general layout (tree at the left, not included in screenshot, list of messages above and the message itself below) and I like the contents of the headers (I don't want to display fewer; I'd just like them to take up less space).

Changing the font via edit / settings / font / size has no effect on the headers (it may be changing the size of the text within the message, but I can't really see enough of that to be sure).

How do I change the font within the headers to a different, smaller, value?

title: Unable to log in at server Error when trying to add Gmail Account
content:
Hi there Thunderbird Community,

I am first time user of Thunderbird, and I am using version 140.2.0esr (64-bit).

I have been trying to connect my Gmail account, and it keeps on giving me this error that I have seen on other threads: "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password."

From the other threads, I tried to do the troubleshooting suggested: 

 - cleared the cookies associated with Google  - added https://account.google.com as an Exception for Cookies and to always allow  - disabled Account Hub since it seems to have issues from what I read on another thread  - changed my Google account password  - tried another Gmail account with no success  - tried various Thunderbird versions, uninstalling the old one before reinstalling the new one:  Thunderbird Release (Recommended), Thunderbird Extended Support Release (current version being used), and Thunderbird Beta.  I have not tried Thunderbird Daily.

I have added Google OAuth screen-by-screen images of what I saw before getting the Thunderbird client error message.

Any ideas?

Thanks! James
creator: cuttingedgegamerllc

Here is a video of this behaviour (link points to video on cryptpad.fr) Here is a video of this behaviour

Any hints? Is there a mechanism which technology is prefered?

Thanks! Thomas

title: Trying to close an account
content:
My name is Leonard C. Beers III and I am contacting you on behalf of my father, Leonard C. Beers JR. My father will be 101 years old next month. He has been a user of Thunderbird for many years and loved it. Unfortunately, his health has declined and is currently under Hospice care. For several months, he has not used thunderbird and will never be able to use it again. That being said, he continues to receive a charge from Thunderbird monthly in the amount of $21.40. I have tried to figure out how to stop his account for a couple of months with no success. I would appreciate it if someone could help me to stop his account and negate any future charges. His email account is len.beers@cfl.rr.com. I can be reached at 321-474-3967 or my email beers.charley@gmail.com. I hope I have given you enough information to help me. Please contact me at any time. Thanks in advance for you help.

Thanks again, Leonard Beers

title: Problems with Gmail account access on Thunderbird
content:
I have been using Thunderbird to access four GMAIL accounts for many years without any problems. Yesterday , due to articles about GMAIL being hacked, I changed the password on all four accounts - same password used on all four.

When I bring up Thunderbird I get the following message  : Authentication failure while trying to connect to server imap.gmail.com

Three of the accounts are working fine. The fourth account I can not receive Emails on. When I try to send ab Email from this account I get: Login in to server smtp.gmail.com with user name xxx failed. Unable to authenticate outgoing server SMTP. This account works fine in Gmail.

All the account settings in Thunderbird are the same. Accept cookies, SSL/TLS , OAuth2, server imap.gmail.com, port465. I am running the latest version of Thunderbird.

I was wondering if the easiest way to fix this is to delete this account from Thuderbird and re-add it?

Thanks in advance for your help - Marty
creator: misterg.mbg
